Sure, I can reformat the checklist into a table. Here it is:

| InDesign Cover Tasks | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Check document size | Ensure that the document size is the correct size for your final printed piece. |
| Bleed | Make sure that your artwork extends beyond the trim area by at least 1/8 inch on all sides. |
| Crop marks | Add crop marks to the document to indicate where the paper should be trimmed. |
| Color mode | Ensure that the document is in CMYK mode for accurate color representation in print. |
| Resolution | Ensure that all images are at least 300 dpi to ensure high-quality printing. |
| Fonts | Embed all fonts in the document to ensure they are available for the print run. |
| Layers | Flatten all layers in the document to avoid issues with transparency or overlapping elements. |
| Proofread | Double-check all text and graphics for errors and proper alignment. |
| Export | Export the document as a print-ready PDF with correct settings for your printer. |
| Check final PDF | Double-check the final PDF for any errors or issues before sending it to the printer. |

This table format makes it easier to read and organize the information in a clear and concise way.
